TunableList.name: LOT_TO_LOTTUNING_MAP
TunableList.description: Mapping of Lot Description ID to lot tuning. This is a reference to a specific lot in one of our regions. e.g. Goth's mansion lot.

TunableList.name: REGION_TO_LOTTUNING_MAP
TunableList.description: Mapping of Region Description ID to spawner tuning. Region and neighborhood are analogous terms. e.g. Garden District. This represents the tuning for all lots in the region that does not have a specific LotTuning specified for itself in either the LOT_TO_LOTTUNING_MAP or via STREET_TO_LOTTUNING_MAP.

TunableList.name: STREET_TO_LOTTUNING_MAP
TunableList.description: Mapping of Street Description ID to lot tuning. Street and world are analogous terms. e.g. suburbs street in Garden District. This represents the tuning for all lots within this street that does not have a specific LotTuning specified for itself in the LOT_TO_LOTTUNING_MAP.

TunableList.name: OBJECT_CLEANUP_TUNING
TunableList.description: A list of actions to take when spinning up a zone in order to fix it up based on statistic values that the lot has.

TunableVariant.name: count
TunableVariant.description: The maximum number of items that will have the action run on them.

TunableTuple.name: all_items
TunableTuple.description: Process all of the objects on the lot.

TunableTuple.name: statistic_difference
TunableTuple.description: Return the difference between two different statistics and use that as the amount of objects to process. If the statistics cannot be found the value 0 is used instead.

Tunable.name: statistic_1
Tunable.description: The first statistic that will be used with the second statistic in order to discover the number of objects on the lot to process. If the statistic is not found then the number 0 is use instead.

Tunable.name: statistic_2
Tunable.description: The second statistic that will be used with the first statistic in order to discover the number of objects on the lot to process. If the statistic is not found then the number 0 is use instead.

TunableTuple.name: statistic_value
TunableTuple.description: Return the value of a statistic on the lot. If the statistic is not found then the number 0 is used instead.

Tunable.name: statistic
Tunable.description: The statistic on the lot that will be used to determine the number of objects to process. If the statistic is not found then the number 0 is used instead.

TunableList.name: possible_actions
TunableList.description: The different possible actions that can be taken on objects on the lot if tests pass.

TunableList.name: actions
TunableList.description: A group of actions to be taken on the object.

TunableVariant.description: The actual action that will be performed on the object if test passes.

TunableTuple.name: cleanup_vehicle
TunableTuple.description: Cleanup a vehicle that isn't being used by destroying it.

TunableTuple.name: set_state
TunableTuple.description: Change the state of an object to the tuned state.

Tunable.name: state
Tunable.description: An state that we want to set the object to.

TunableTuple.name: statistic_change
TunableTuple.description: Modify the statistic value of an object.

TunableVariant.name: amount
TunableVariant.description: The amount to modify the statistic by.

Tunable.name: amount
Tunable.description: A constant amount to change the statistic by.

TunableTuple.name: statistic_based
TunableTuple.description: An amount that is based on the statistic value of a statistic on the lot.

Tunable.name: multiplier
Tunable.description: A multiplier on the statistic value of the statistic on the lot.

Tunable.name: statistic
Tunable.description: A statistic on the lot who's value will be used as the amount to modify a statistic. If no value is found the number 0 is used.

Tunable.name: statistic
Tunable.description: The statistic to be changed on the object.

TdescFragTag.name: tests
TdescFragTag.description: Tests that if they pass the object will be under consideration for this action being done on them.

TunableList.name: OBJECT_COUNT_TUNING
TunableList.description: Mapping between statistic and a set of tests that are run over the objects on the lot on save. The value of the statistic is set to the number of objects that pass the tests.

Tunable.name: key
Tunable.description: The statistic on the lot that will be set the value of the number of objects that pass the test set that it is mapped to.

TdescFragTag.name: value
TdescFragTag.description: Test set that will be run on all objects on the lot to determine what the value of the key statistic should be set to.

TunableList.name: SET_STATISTIC_TUNING
TunableList.description: A list of statistics and values that they will be set to on the lot while saving it when the lot was running. These values are set before counting by tests on objects.

Tunable.name: amount
Tunable.description: The value that the statistic will be set to.

Tunable.name: statistic
Tunable.description: The statistic that will have its value set.
